excerpt: Banff is a resort town in the province of Alberta, located within Banff National Park. The peaks of Mt. Rundle and Mt. Cascade, part of the Rocky Mountains, dominate its skyline. On Banff Avenue, the main thoroughfare, boutiques and restaurants mix with château-style hotels and souvenir shops. The surrounding 6,500 square kilometres of parkland are home to wildlife including elk and grizzly bears.
detail_description: Banff, a charming resort town in Alberta, is nestled within Banff National Park and surrounded by the majestic Rocky Mountains. The town's main street, Banff Avenue, is lined with boutique shops, restaurants, and château-style hotels. Visitors can explore the 6,500 square kilometers of parkland teeming with wildlife such as elk and grizzly bears. The Fairmont hotel chain offers luxurious accommodations in Banff Springs and Chateau Lake Louise.
name: Banff
address: Alberta, Canada

excerpt: Canada's first national park, with hot mineral springs in a cave & an outdoor, emerald-colored pool.
detail_description: Cave and Basin National Historic Site is a significant landmark in Canada, as it was the birthplace of the country's national parks system. Discovered by railway workers in 1883, this site offers interactive exhibits that showcase Canada's network of protected places. Visitors can take guided tours of the original cave to learn about its history and culture, including lantern tours for an after-dark experience.
name: Cave and Basin National Historic Site
address: 311 Cave Ave, Banff, AB T1L 1K2, Canada

excerpt: Canada's highest thermal mineral springs, with a preserved 1930s bathhouse & Rockies panoramas.
detail_description: Banff Upper Hot Springs is a historic thermal mineral springs located in Banff National Park, Canada. The hot springs were discovered in the late 1880s and have since become a popular destination for visitors seeking relaxation and rejuvenation. Situated at an elevation of over 5,000ft in the Rocky Mountains, the natural pool offers stunning panoramic views of the surrounding landscape.
name: Banff Upper Hot Springs
address: 1 Mountain Ave, Banff, AB T1L 1K2, Canada

excerpt: Landscape paintings, Rockies heritage exhibits & preserved examples of early Banff homes & cabins.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Banff, the Whyte Museum of the Canadian Rockies is a treasure trove for those eager to explore the rich tapestry of history and culture that defines this stunning region. Since its inception in 1968, it has served as a cultural hub, showcasing an impressive collection that spans geological history and human experiences—from Indigenous communities to European explorers. Visitors can immerse themselves in captivating landscape paintings and heritage exhibits while also discovering preserved examples of early Banff homes and cabins.
name: Whyte Museum of the Canadian Rockies
address: 111 Bear St, Banff, AB T1L 1A3, Canada

excerpt: Landmark 1903 building & National Historic Site displaying natural history & educational exhibits.
detail_description: The Banff Park Museum National Historic Site, located at 92 Banff Avenue in Alberta, Canada, is a significant landmark that showcases the country's early approach to natural history and conservation. Housed in a rustic log building constructed in 1895, the museum features over 5,000 vintage specimens of plants, minerals, and animals associated with Banff National Park. The collection includes stuffed animals, geological finds, and an extensive library.
name: Banff Park Museum National Historic Site
address: 91 Banff Ave, Banff, AB T1L 1K2, Canada

excerpt: Beyond its scenic, wooded landscape & sweeping views, this mountain features numerous hiking trails.
detail_description: Tunnel Mountain, located in Banff National Park, is the smallest summit in the region and offers a variety of hiking trails suitable for beginners. Despite its easy incline, hikers can enjoy stunning views of the Bow and Spray River valleys, Banff Springs Golf Course, and Banff Hot Springs on Sulphur Mountain. The highway that crosses the mountain provides a scenic drive and serves as the main access route to Banff.
name: Tunnel Mountain
address: Improvement District No. 9, AB T1L 1H5, Canada

excerpt: Calm gondola ride to a mountaintop for sweeping views of surrounding peaks, plus dining & a museum.
detail_description: The Banff Gondola offers a serene ride to the top of Sulphur Mountain, providing breathtaking panoramic views of the surrounding peaks. At the summit, visitors can stroll out to a grassy bluff overlooking Banff town and marvel at the majestic mountains. The gondola ascends in just eight minutes, leading to observation decks and boardwalks at the peak. Additionally, guests can enjoy dining at Sky Bistro, an upscale restaurant with stunning mountain vistas.
name: Banff Gondola
address: 100 Mountain Ave, Banff, AB T1L 1J3, Canada

excerpt: Set in a big river valley eroded by past glaciers, this wide & short waterfall is a local landmark.
detail_description: Bow Falls is a wide and short waterfall located near The Fairmont Banff Springs, just before the confluence of the Bow and Spray rivers. The Bow River plunges over sloping limestone ledges, creating a local landmark that offers excellent perspectives of crashing gray-green water. Visitors can take in the view from the Bow Falls Trail, which runs along the river and provides benches for relaxation. Across the river at Surprise Corner, there's an ideal spot for capturing picturesque photos of this natural wonder.
name: Bow Falls
address: Banff, AB T1L 1B4, Canada

excerpt: Trio of lakes offering hiking & biking trails, native wildlife & rental boats/paddle boards.
detail_description: Vermilion Lakes, located in the Vermilion Valley near the entrance of Banff National Park, offer a convenient and picturesque setting for outdoor activities. Accessible by car, these lakes are popular among families and beginners looking to enjoy kayaking or canoeing without embarking on long hikes. Surrounded by mountains and trees, the serene lakes provide stunning reflections of the peaks.
name: Vermilion Lakes
address: Improvement District No. 9, AB T1L 1C3, Canada

detail_description: Mount Norquay Lookout is a popular destination for skiers and snowboarders, offering a variety of lodging options from luxury chalets to cozy cabins. It's conveniently located near the town resort of Mt. Norquay and other attractions in Banff. Visitors can enjoy engaging outdoor activities such as skiing, mountain biking, and hiking to admire natural wonders like the Hoodoos.
name: Mount Norquay Lookout
address: Mt Norquay Scenic Dr, Banff, AB T0L 1E0, Canada

excerpt: Fortlike museum with many artifacts showcasing the history of local indigenous Canadians.
detail_description: The Buffalo Nations Museum, located in Banff, Alberta, is a fort-like museum that houses a diverse collection of artifacts showcasing the history and culture of the indigenous First Nations people who lived in and around the Canadian Rockies. The museum specializes in preserving the rich heritage of Canada with exhibits featuring early Indian civilizations, photography displays, a variety of musical instruments, and seasonal events such as ceremonies, dances, and songs.
name: Buffalo Nations Museum
address: 1 Birch Ave, Banff, AB T1L 1A8, Canada

excerpt: Scenic viewpoint overlooking the 1888 Fairmont Banff Springs Hotel & Sulphur Mountain.
detail_description: Surprise Corner Viewpoint is a popular spot in Banff that offers stunning views of the 1888 Fairmont Banff Springs Hotel and Sulphur Mountain. The name 'Surprise Corner' comes from the unexpected and breathtaking vistas that greet visitors as they round the corner. It's a budget-friendly option for travelers, as it's one of the many free things to do in Banff.
name: Surprise Corner Viewpoint
address: Buffalo St, Banff, AB T1L 1K2, Canada

excerpt: Tranquil, terraced gardens featuring landscaped paths & sitting areas amid diverse trees & flowers.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Banff, the Cascade of Time Garden offers a serene escape from the hustle and bustle. Since its establishment in 1930, this four-acre terraced park has captivated visitors with its meticulously landscaped pathways, water features, and vibrant flora. Just a short walk from downtown Banff, it provides a perfect vantage point for admiring the surrounding mountains and blooming flowers during the warmer months.
name: Cascade of Time Garden
address: Cave Ave, Banff, AB T1L 1K2, Canada

excerpt: Large ski resort & tubing park also offering dining options & year-round recreation activities.
detail_description: Mount Norquay is a large ski resort and tubing park that offers dining options and year-round recreational activities. Adrenaline seekers can enjoy snowtubing with a towing system or try ice climbing with experienced guides. Other winter experiences include guided snowshoeing, ice walking, romantic sleigh rides, and ice-skating on Lake Louise. In the summer, visitors can paddle the turquoise waters of Lake Louise, raft down the Bow River, and conquer mountainous trails.
name: Mount Norquay
address: 2 Mt Norquay Rd, Banff, AB T1L 1B4, Canada

excerpt: Mesquite-grilled meats, gourmet comfort eats & small-batch spirits in a hip & rustic space.
detail_description: PARK Distillery Restaurant + Bar is a trendy spot in Alberta, offering small-batch spirits and gourmet comfort food in a rustic setting. The restaurant boasts a diverse menu of rotisserie and wood-fired grilled meats, along with unique dishes like cheese and whisky fondue and cornflake pulled pork fingers with maple whisky and bacon dipping sauce. Their cocktails are top-notch, reflecting their expertise in crafting spirits. Additionally, visitors can enjoy a free distillery tour to enhance their experience.
name: PARK Distillery Restaurant + Bar
address: 219 Banff Ave, Banff, AB T1L 1A7, Canada

excerpt: Town Hall building home to the Banff townsite government headquarters, within Banff National Park.
detail_description: Nestled within Banff National Park, the Town of Banff is a bustling hub offering a mix of urban amenities and natural beauty. Visitors can explore the downtown area, which boasts an array of attractions such as shops, eateries, art galleries, and museums like the Banff Park Museum and Whyte Museum of the Canadian Rockies. For those seeking to tie the knot amidst stunning landscapes, special permits from both the National Park and Town Hall are required.
name: Town of Banff
address: 110 Bear St, Banff, AB T1L 1H7, Canada

excerpt: Waking & biking trails run alongside this popular, scenic waterfall featured in several 1950s films.
detail_description: Bow Falls Viewpoint is a popular spot in Banff, known for its scenic waterfall that has been featured in 1950s films. The trail alongside the Bow River offers an easy stroll with picturesque views of the river and surrounding mountains. Starting at the south base of the pedestrian bridge, the trail passes through a forested area with benches for taking in the scenery. It's only a 1.
name: Bow Falls Viewpoint
address: Bow Falls Ave, Banff, AB T0L 0C0, Canada

excerpt: Driving range & a pair of 18-hole golf courses lined with pine forest & backed by mountain scenery.
detail_description: The Fairmont Banff Springs Golf Course is a stunning destination for golf enthusiasts, offering two 18-hole courses surrounded by picturesque pine forests and majestic mountain views. Located just a 30-minute drive from Canmore, this Stanley Thompson-designed masterpiece is situated near the iconic nine-story hotel known as Canada's Castle in the Rockies. The course provides an unforgettable golfing experience amidst breathtaking natural scenery.
name: Fairmont Banff Springs Golf Course
address: 405 Spray Avenue, Banff, AB T1L 1J4, Canada

detail_description: Rocky Mountain Raft Tours offers guided rafting adventures on the Kicking Horse River, known for its thrilling white water rafting experiences. Located near Banff, this popular day trip destination provides an exhilarating ride for adventure seekers. Additionally, visitors can enjoy a variety of outdoor activities such as skiing, snowboarding, hiking, biking trails, and chairlift flightseeing at Mount Norquay.
name: Rocky Mountain Raft Tours
address: 1 Golf Course Rd, Banff, AB T0L 0C0, Canada

detail_description: The Banff Legacy Trail is a stunning 29 km paved pathway that stretches from Canmore to the Bow Valley Parkway, offering breathtaking mountain views and picturesque picnic spots along the way. Ideal for cyclists, walkers, and runners alike, this trail provides an excellent opportunity to immerse yourself in nature's beauty. While it’s not maintained during winter months, visiting in autumn reveals a spectacular display of colors against the backdrop of the majestic mountains.
name: Banff Legacy Trail
address: Vermilion Lakes Rd, Banff, AB T0L 1E0, Canada

excerpt: Popular hiking & jogging trail leading to a low peak with views of the town & surrounding mountains.
detail_description: Tunnel Mountain Trail is a popular 4.3-kilometer hiking and jogging trail that leads to a low peak offering panoramic views of the town of Banff and its surrounding mountains. Despite being more like a big hill than a mountain, it provides an outstanding viewpoint and is considered an easy-to-moderate hike suitable for all skill levels. The moderately challenging trail takes approximately 1.
name: Tunnel Mountain Trail
address: Improvement District No. 9, AB, Canada

detail_description: When visiting Banff, leaving the car at the campsite and taking a stroll to the Roam Transit bus stop is a convenient way to explore the area. The company offers services to top attractions during the main season, with pick-up locations throughout Banff. The drivers are helpful and ensure passengers board the right bus. One passenger had an exceptional experience with a friendly and knowledgeable driver named Sarabpal. Overall, riders appreciate the reliability, efficiency, cleanliness, and maintenance of Roam Transit buses.
name: Bow Valley Regional Transit Services Commission - Roam Transit
address: 224 Banff Ave, Banff, AB T1L 1A5, Canada

excerpt: Bustling city main street lined with art galleries, restaurants, local shops & coffeehouses.
detail_description: Banff Ave is a lively main street in the city, featuring art galleries, restaurants, local shops, and coffeehouses. The avenue is connected to the Brett Sanitorium by a historic iron truss bridge dating back to 1887. This bridge was commissioned by Park Superintendent George Stewart to transport visitors from the train station to various attractions.
name: Banff Ave
address: Improvement District No. 9, AB, Canada

excerpt: Peak in Banff National Park accessible via hike or gondola, with observation decks & an eatery.
detail_description: Sulphur Mountain, located in Banff National Park, is a popular destination accessible by both a gondola ride and hiking trails. The Banff Gondola offers an 8-minute journey to the summit, providing breathtaking panoramic views of the Bow Valley and six mountain ranges. Visitors can also take the Sulphur Mountain Boardwalk to Sansons Peak for even more stunning vistas and a visit to the historic Sulphur Mountain Cosmic Ray Station.
name: Sulphur Mountain
address: Improvement District No. 9, AB T1L 1J2, Canada

detail_description: The Rocky Mountaineer Banff Guest Centre offers a unique way to explore the Canadian Rockies, with train trips ranging from 1 day to over 2 weeks. The company operates over 75 rail cars across 4 principal routes from Seattle or Vancouver through the heart of the Rockies to Calgary. Travelers can enjoy luxury comfort and stunning views in Gold Leaf class, which features an upper deck and glass ceiling.
name: Rocky Mountaineer Banff Guest Centre
address: 220 Bear St, Banff, AB T1L 1A1, Canada

excerpt: Large 2-storey brewpub for ales by the glass or growler, with burgers, steaks, pasta & poutine.
detail_description: Banff Ave Brewing Co. is a large 2-storey brewpub offering a variety of ales by the glass or growler, along with a menu featuring burgers, steaks, pasta, and poutine. The brewery uses top-quality wheat and barley grown in Alberta, which are also the region's primary exports. With glacial fresh water from Banff's taps, they produce award-winning beer. Additionally, the establishment participates in events alongside other Alberta craft breweries.
name: Banff Ave Brewing Co.
address: 110 Banff Ave, Banff, AB T1L 1A9, Canada

excerpt: Information on regional hikes, parks & other local activities, plus a souvenir shop.
detail_description: When exploring the stunning landscapes of Banff National Park, a visit to the Banff Visitor Centre is an essential stop. Nestled in the heart of Banff village on Banff Avenue, this hub is staffed by knowledgeable representatives from various local organizations, including Parks Canada and Friends of Banff. They are eager to assist you with valuable insights about regional hikes, parks, and other activities that will enhance your adventure.
name: Banff Visitor Centre
address: 224 Banff Ave, Banff, AB T1L 1B3, Canada

excerpt: Sprawling ski resort featuring a variety of dining & shopping options, plus year-round activities.
detail_description: Banff Sunshine Village Ski & Snowboard Resort is a sprawling destination offering various dining and shopping options, as well as year-round activities. In winter, visitors can enjoy world-class skiing at the resort along with two other ski areas in the park. The summer season attracts adventurers interested in activities such as paddling on Lake Louise and hiking scenic trails like the Johnston Canyon to Ink Pots route.
name: Banff Sunshine Village Ski & Snowboard Resort
address: Alberta, Canada

detail_description: Nestled in the breathtaking landscape of Banff, the Banff Centre for Arts and Creativity has been a beacon of cultural enrichment since its establishment in 1933. This vibrant hub serves as a melting pot where art meets innovative ideas, encouraging visitors to tap into their creative spirit. With an array of events ranging from music and dance to film and theater, there's always something happening at this dynamic venue.
name: Banff Centre for Arts and Creativity
address: 107 Tunnel Mountain Dr, Banff, AB T1L 1H5, Canada

detail_description: Fenland Trailhead is a family-friendly 1.2-mile loop that takes you through a white spruce forest and along the shores of Forty Mile Creek and Vermillion Lakes in Banff. The trail offers opportunities for picnicking by the creek and spotting wildlife like elk, deer, and various birds. It's also part of the Bow River Trail, allowing for extended excursions through downtown Banff.
name: Fenland Trailhead
address: Improvement District No. 9, AB T1L 1K2, Canada

excerpt: Green space at a bend in the river with picnic tables, a playground & a gazebo used for events.
detail_description: Central Park is a picturesque green space located at a bend in the river, offering various amenities and attractions for visitors. The park features picnic tables, a playground with natural elements blending into the stunning scenery, and a gazebo used for events. Visitors can start their leisurely stroll near the boat docks and enjoy the riverside walk past Central Park, under Banff's main vehicle bridge, and towards the new award-winning pedestrian bridge.
name: Central Park
address: 110 Bear St, Banff, AB T1L 1A1, Canada

excerpt: Low-key gallery, established in 1974, featuring contemporary local art, sculpture & native crafts.
detail_description: Nestled in Banff, Alberta, Canada House Gallery has been a prominent fixture since the 1970s. It boasts an extensive collection of art by resident artists from across the country and is known for its focus on contemporary local art, sculpture, and native crafts. The gallery regularly hosts temporary exhibitions featuring paintings and sculptures available for purchase. With a strong emphasis on Inuit artwork, it offers visitors a chance to immerse themselves in Canadian creativity.
name: Canada House Gallery
address: 201 Bear St, Banff, AB T1L 1B5, Canada

name: Troll Falls Trailhead
address: Kananaskis, AB T1W 2W3, Canada

detail_description: All In The Wild Gallery is a delightful haven for those who appreciate the beauty of nature and wildlife. Nestled in the heart of Banff, this gallery showcases an impressive array of fine art, including stunning paintings, sculptures, and photography that highlight the breathtaking landscapes and rich biodiversity of the region. Visitors are often captivated by the exquisite works created by both local and international artists inspired by Banff National Park's natural wonders.
name: All In The Wild Gallery
address: 105 Banff Ave, Banff, AB T1L 1B6, Canada

name: Douglas Fir Water Park
address: Douglas Fir Resort, Banff, AB T0L, Canada

detail_description: Nestled within the breathtaking Fairmont Banff Springs Hotel, Mountain Galleries is a must-visit destination for art enthusiasts exploring the Canadian Rockies. Established in 1992 by artist and filmmaker Wendy Wacko, this gallery has grown to become one of Western Canada's largest commercial art spaces, with additional locations in Jasper and Whistler.
name: Mountain Galleries at the Fairmont Banff
address: 405 Spray Ave, Banff, AB T1L 1A9, Canada

detail_description: This small Catholic parish is located in Banff and offers a traditional Mass service. The church is decorated with beautiful stained glass and has a welcoming atmosphere.
name: Saint Mary Roman Catholic Parish
address: 305 Squirrel St, Banff, AB T1L 1B1, Canada

excerpt: Contemporary art space running exhibitions in media including video, plus a permanent collection.
detail_description: Nestled within the breathtaking landscape of Banff, the Walter Phillips Gallery serves as a vibrant hub for contemporary art enthusiasts. This dynamic space showcases an impressive array of artistic expressions, including video installations, paintings, sculptures, and textiles. The gallery is dedicated to fostering artistic innovation and cultural dialogue while providing visitors with a unique opportunity to connect deeply with both art and nature. Surrounded by the majestic Rocky Mountains, it offers an immersive experience that enhances appreciation for visual arts in all its forms.
name: Walter Phillips Gallery
address: 107 Tunnel Mountain Dr, Banff, AB T1L 1H5, Canada

excerpt: 9,500-ft. peak & provincial border in the Rocky Mountains, named for its resemblance to a beehive.
detail_description: Nestled in the stunning Rocky Mountains, The Beehive is a breathtaking 9,500-foot peak that draws hikers with its unique shape reminiscent of an actual beehive. For those looking to immerse themselves in the beauty of Lake Louise, embarking on a comprehensive hike that includes the Lake Louise Lakeshore, Lake Agnes Trail, Beehive Circuit, and Plain of Six Glaciers Trail is an absolute must.
name: The Beehive
address: Improvement District No. 9, AB T0L 1E0, Canada

detail_description: When in Banff, make sure to visit the iconic Banff Town Sign located on the outskirts of the town. This picturesque spot not only offers stunning views of the surrounding mountains but also serves as a gateway to an adventure-filled experience in the Canadian Rockies. While some may see it as just a photo opportunity, others view it as an Instagram-worthy spot that marks the beginning or end of their trip.
name: Banff Town Sign
address: 101 Mt Norquay Rd, Banff, AB T1L 1C3, Canada

detail_description: Jeff Walker Gallery is a charming and welcoming space that showcases a diverse collection of artistic expressions, including paintings, sculptures, photography, and mixed-media creations. Visitors are drawn to the captivating stories behind the artwork, adding depth and meaning to each piece. The gallery's cozy atmosphere invites guests to immerse themselves in the vividly real scenes captured in the artwork. Knowledgeable and friendly staff members enhance the experience by providing helpful insights into the pieces on display.
name: Jeff Walker Gallery
address: 135 Banff Ave, Banff, AB T1L 1C9, Canada

detail_description: Hoodoos Viewpoint offers a stunning vantage point of the Bow River Valley and Mount Rundle, with the added bonus of potentially spotting wildlife like elk crossing the river below. The Surprise Corner to Hoodoos Trail is an easy hike that leads to this iconic viewpoint, passing by the Banff Springs Hotel along the way. There are two scenic trails leading to the Hoodoos, which are unique rock formations offering breathtaking views of the surrounding area.
name: Hoodoos Viewpoint
address: Improvement District No. 9, AB T1L 1K2, Canada

detail_description: Banff Rotary Park is a small but convenient playground located near the main area of Banff. It offers a grassy area, picnic tables, and a short walking path. The playground is suitable for younger kids and provides ample shade from surrounding trees. While there are no adult facilities or an ice rink as suggested by some visitors, it's still a nice spot for families to relax and let their children play. Additionally, the park offers free parking making it easily accessible for visitors.
name: Banff Rotary Park
address: Banff, AB T1L 1C6, Canada

detail_description: The Banff Visitor Information Kiosk is a must-visit for anyone exploring the town of Banff or the village of Lake Louise. Located at 224 Banff Avenue and Samson Mall respectively, these centers offer a wealth of resources including free brochures, maps, and flyers with occasional coupons for local dining and attractions. The friendly staff are knowledgeable about the area and there are interpretive exhibits to enhance your understanding of the region.
name: Banff Visitor Information Kiosk
address: @Banff Heritage Railway Station, 327 Railway Ave, Banff, AB T1L 1A9, Canada

name: Mount Lougheed View Point
address: 302 George Biggy Sr Rd, Canmore, AB T1W 3J8, Canada
